author: The Editorial Board
title: The Bishops of Xi Jinping
text:
Few prelates have ever been as blunt in criticizing the Holy See as Joseph Cardinal Zen, the retired bishop of Hong Kong. In an open letter earlier this week, the cardinal put it this way: “Do I think that the Vatican is selling out the Catholic Church in China? Yes, definitely.”

Cardinal Zen was speaking about the Vatican’s bid to force two underground Catholic bishops faithful to the church to resign—and be replaced by government-backed bishops who were excommunicated when they were illicitly appointed. So concerned was...
